subject: Re: Asserts
msgSnippet: Thank you. So, are you saying that an assertion is a kind of test to see if an expression will succeed or fail, and if it fails, then it is recorded in a log,
messageBody:
Thank you.
So, are you saying that an assertion is a kind of test to see if an
expression will succeed or fail, and if it fails, then it is recorded
in a log, and then it will show up after the test suite is done?

So, say for example we have this statement:

assertEquals( 0, f.getScore() );

Would this be testing to see if f.getScore is going to return 0, and
if it does return 0, then the assertion succeeded, if it does not
return 0, then the assertion failed?

Ed

--- In junit@y..., Michael Finney <mfinney@n...> wrote:
> from the zip file
> junit3.5\javadoc\junit\framework\Assert.html
>
>
>
> class
> junit.framework.Assert which is extended by
junit.framework.TestCase
>
> assertEquals
> public static void assertEquals(int expected,
> int actual)
> Asserts that two ints are equal.
>
>
>
> if the assertion fails, it is recorded. When the suite of tests is
done, it
> should show up.
>
> Michael Finney
> Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
> Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: tamago000@y... [SMTP:tamago000@y...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, February 20, 2001 1:57 PM
> > To: junit@y...
> > Subject: [junit] Asserts
> >
> > Hi. I am relatively new to both Junit and Java in general. I
hope
> > you guys will bear with me here. What are all the assert methods
> > used for in Junit? I cant seem to find anything in the
documentation
> > for junit that will explain them. For example, what is the
purpose
> > of assertEquals? Here is the document I was looking at:
> >
> > <http://www.objectmentor.com/publications/xpepisode.htm>
> >
> > And here is the code in question:
> >
> > public class TestFrame extends TestCase
> > {
> > public TestFrame( String name )
> > {
> > super( name );
> > }
> >
> > public void testScoreNoThrows()
> > {
> > Frame f = new Frame();
> > assertEquals( 0, f.getScore() );
> > }
> > }
> >
> > What is it that assertequals is doing here? Is this some kind of
if-
> > then statement to find out if the f.getScore method returns a 0?
I
> > am confused.
> >
> > Any help here would be very appreciated.
> >
> > Ed Goble
